Letters from former slaves of Terrell settled in Liberia, 1857-1866
Letters from former slaves of Terrell settled in Liberia, 1857-1866
January 19, 1860 from Margaret Coleman to Dr. James H. Minor
Careysburg Jan 19 th 1860 Mr. J. H. Minor Dear Sir

I write you these lines to inform you of my health which is quite well at present.. I hope these lines will find the Same.. Give my beset respects to Father.. Please Send me Some Nailes. no.. 6 & no 8.. I have no r house.. I recive.. 1 pare Shouese from you. I wold thank you for you to send one keag of Powder.. &. 1. kage of [illeg.] fish.. Please Send me Some calco.. & Some blue denims ed.. Please Send 2 par shuese Gators & fifty lbs of Tobacco.. One Box of Soap. half barrel of Flour Â½ Flour & Sugar the thengs I Sent for please Send she them to me, Becaus I have all the children with me & this country is hard please send me one Ax & 2 hoes
Margaret Coleman to Dr. James H. Minor 1860 January 19
Margaret Coleman to Dr. James H. Minor 1860 January 19
